title: Networking
subtitle: The Net-Work Technique
description: Thousands of welded steel rods forge semi-transparent lattices — forms that simultaneously shield and reveal, where the interplay of light and shadow becomes the true medium.

works.title: Persona
works.description: The word 'person' comes from the Latin *persona*—meaning 'mask'. Composed of 3,000 to 5,000 welded rods, this sculpture suggests that a person is neither the player nor the living being, but the role itself—a structure of perception solidified into identity.

works.title: Sphere
works.description: A symbol of perfection built from fragments. The gaps between bars are not absences, but invitations for light to pass—honoring the paradox that only through imperfection can perfection be glimpsed.

works.title: Amphora
works.description: The sacred vessel reimagined. When light glows from within, it does not illuminate the amphora but dissolves it. A paradox of presence and absence—not an amphora, but the idea of one, burning at its core.

works.title: The Presence
works.description: 25,000 welded bars coalesce into a transparent veil. The visage emerges not as solid form, but as elusive suggestion. The veil speaks to universal maternal anxiety—the quiet dread of a mother watching her child walk toward an uncertain destiny.

works.title: The Awakening
works.description: Titans of the subconscious, ancient and new gods embodied in self-awareness. Steel becomes a tool crafting a tangible emblem that harbors a message encrypted in symbolic shapes and veiled symmetries.

works.title: Vitreolum
works.description: A face emerging from a web of iron bars—stern, noble, frozen in rigid geometry. It does not ask to be known, only to be witnessed. Both mask and revelation, its hollow eyes remind us that every face is a scaffold of perceptions waiting to be dismantled.

works.title: The Relic
works.description: Universal, classical, a relic of antiquity. The face endures not despite its transparency, but because of it—a structure perceived as whole, yet built from countless fragments. A symbol that admits its own construction.

works.title: Memento Mori
works.description: Matte black mesh playing with perception. Shadows and lights weave through the voids to complete the portrait. A dialogue between material and absence, transforming the wall into a canvas of fleeting impressions.

works.title: The Guardian
works.description: Both fortress and figure. Heavy, raw, and unyielding, yet the contours flow with unexpected grace. A shield guarding the unseen vitality within—posing the warning: What lies behind this armored visage?

works.title: Iron Maiden
works.description: A fusion of industrial rigor and poetic fragility. Blurring the lines between painting and sculpture, its intricate mesh creates a portrait in constant flux, where the unseen speaks as loudly as the forged.

works.title: Amazona
works.description: Evoking the Amazon's tangled branches and rivers. Two harmonious forms converge into a visage both ancient and alive. A silent dialogue between land and river, inviting contemplation on the enduring forces of nature.

works.title: Fragments — Eye
works.description: Beauty emerging from brokenness. These fragmented compositions evoke resilience, revealing intricate details and hidden connections—a celebration of the beautifully imperfect nature of existence.

works.title: Fragments — Kiss
works.description: An exploration of the timeless theme of love and emotional identity. Crafted from thousands of metal elements, it parallels the Persona series but delves deeper into the complexities of human connection.

works.title: Ripple
works.description: A fusion of art and science from the Waterdrop series. Inspired by the double-slit experiment, 15,000 bars form a ripple that explores the mysteries of quantum physics and the primordial energies shaping reality.

works.title: Ichor
works.description: Named for the ethereal fluid of the gods. Rusted with flames and acids, it represents primordial energy—the absolute opposite of the Persona's human mask. Primordial energy captured in a net-work of steel.

works.title: Iron Tapestry
works.description: A transparent wall relief crafted from over 10,000 bars. It delicately weaves the background into its visual narrative, creating an individual piece that captivates at the intersection of strength and modernity.

title: Portraits
subtitle: Bronze Busts
description: Disciplined realism capturing the private pulse behind the public face — each bust a testament to the enduring dialogue between bronze, memory, and the figures who shaped history.

works.title: Dr. Franjo Tuđman
works.description: A series of memorial busts charting Croatia's transition, placed in public spaces throughout the country. Each portrait captures the gravity of leadership and the weight of historical moment.

works.title: J.R.R. Tolkien
works.description: A portrait rendered with the same patience as Tolkien's own world-building. Capturing the creator of Middle-earth in the quietude of thought.

works.title: The Unbreakable (Hypatia)
works.description: Hypatia of Alexandria, symbolized as an 'unbreakable mask'. Cast in a proprietary blend of carbon and concrete, polished to a high gloss—a monument to the resilience of intellect against the erasure of time.

works.title: Prof. Predrag Keros
works.description: A bronze bust for the University of Applied Health Sciences in Zagreb, honoring a lifetime of medical scholarship.

works.title: Prof. Ivo Brešan
works.description: Installed at the Croatian National Theatre in Šibenik, this portrait captures the intensity of one of Croatia's foremost playwrights.

works.title: Josip Juraj Strossmayer
works.description: A memorial bust for the Croatian Chamber of Economy, honoring the bishop, politician, and patron who championed South Slavic unity and cultural institutions.

works.title: Nietzsche and Zarathustra
works.description: A dialogue between the tense philosopher and his serene ideal. Two faces in bronze—one restless, the other transcendent—capturing the eternal struggle of the Übermensch.

title: Coins
subtitle: Medals & Numismatics
description: Microrealism and hyperrealism engraved in negative form — coin prototypes no taller than 1.2mm in relief, each a miniature universe of precision. Recognized as an 'A1' class medalist globally.

works.title: Euro Circulation Coins
works.description: Executive author of the Croatian national side. Glagolitic script, Nikola Tesla, the Marten, and the Map—icons of identity minted into the everyday currency of a continent.

works.title: Croatian Black Lizard
works.description: Gold and silver coins capturing the endemic black lizard. Deep patina mirroring volcanic soil, engraved at a microscopic scale to honor a rare survivor of the natural world.

works.title: King Tomislav — 1100th Anniversary
works.description: Commemorating 1100 years of the Croatian Kingdom (925–2025). Micro-engraved royal insignia and profile, forged in gold and silver to mark a millennium of statehood.

works.title: King Tomislav 2 Euro
works.description: Croatian commemorative 2 Euro coin, marking the foundational moment of Croatian statehood.

works.title: Dražen Petrović
works.description: Honoring the 'Mozart of Basketball'. A figure who transcended sport to become a symbol of excellence. The coin captures the kinetic energy of a legend frozen in silver and gold.

works.title: 75th VE Day Anniversary
works.description: Silver commemorative coin marking the 75th Anniversary of Victory in Europe Day, 1945–2020.

works.title: 350th University of Zagreb
works.description: Gold and silver coins celebrating 350 years of the University of Zagreb (1669–2019), the oldest continuously operating university in Southeast Europe.

works.title: Dalmatian
works.description: The Dalmatian dog, its spots rendered as the silhouettes of Croatian islands. Geography encoded in a coat—a playful yet precise tribute to one of Croatia's most recognizable global symbols.

works.title: Commemorative 2 Euro
works.description: Croatian commemorative 2 Euro coin, issued through the Croatian National Bank and Monetary Institute.

works.title: Cravat
works.description: Gold and silver coins celebrating the cravat — Croatia's gift to world fashion, the necktie born from the uniforms of 17th-century Croatian soldiers.

works.title: Višnjan
works.description: Honoring the Višnjan Observatory. A coin that looks to the stars, celebrating the small town that discovers worlds beyond our own.

works.title: 30 Years Croatian Mint
works.description: A commemorative medal marking three decades of the Croatian Monetary Institute — the institution that forged a nation's currency.

title: Polygonal
subtitle: Geometric Forms
description: Metal polygon plates converge into monumental animal forms and crystalline geometries — where mathematical precision meets mythological weight.

works.title: Poseidon, The Olympian
works.description: The trident lifted to calm the storm. Metal polygon plates lend modern geometric precision to a timeless mythic figure. Rusted CorTen patina adds the weight of ages to this 4-meter titan.

works.title: Musk Ox
works.description: Standing sentinel over the vineyard. The CorTen patina creates a deliberate contrast with the green vines—rust against leaf, age against growth, endurance against the turn of seasons.

works.title: Rhino (Sudan Tribute)
works.description: A tribute to Sudan, the last white rhino. Minimalist polygonal design serving as a stark reminder that less is more—a monument to a species lost, a call to protect what remains.

works.title: The Illuminated Concept
works.description: A diamond with open edges, emanating light from within. A metaphor for the Platonic idea—pure concept radiance outward, transforming the heavy steel into a vessel of light.

works.title: Diamond Collection
works.description: CorTen steel crystallized into geometric permanence. The warm patina of weathering steel turns into an organic hue, suggesting stability and endurance in the modern landscape.

works.title: COP28: The Seven Realms
works.description: Seven black diamonds for the seven Emirates. Coated in 'galactic black'—pearls, iron oxide, and metallic particles forged into cosmic weight. A constellation on earth.

title: Public Works
subtitle: Monumental & Interventions
description: Large-scale commissions that transform public space — from 12-meter Tesla monuments to interactive water gates, each installation altering the dialogue between art, architecture, and the community that surrounds it.

works.title: Tomislavus Rex Croatorum
works.description: The head of King Tomislav, presented as a fragmented ruin. Effectively a modern archaeological find, it speaks to the cyclical nature of history and the resilience of cultural memory.

works.title: The Violin (Music)
works.description: Engineering meets sound. Steel and bolts evoke the Eiffel Tower, while four playable strings invite participation. A sculpture that is not just seen, but heard—a monument to the universal language of music.

works.title: Tesla Power Line
works.description: A 12-meter monument to Nikola Tesla in the form of a power line. converting functional industrial infrastructure into aesthetic form—a tribute to the man who electrified the world.

works.title: Gates of Purgatory
works.description: A water curtain integrated into a rigid iron gate. Every passerby walks through a threshold of living water—a harmonic intervention where the industrial yields to the elemental.

works.title: Geryon Cattle
works.description: Magnificent beasts with coats red as sunset. Standing in Varaždin, they recall the Tenth Labor and the mythic origins of Italy—the 'land of bulls'.

works.title: Ceryneian Hind
works.description: Sacred to Artemis, this enormous hind symbolizes the purification of the higher intellect. Capturing it required devotion rather than force—a labor of patience rendered in steel.

works.title: Enso
works.description: The circle that is never quite closed. A gesture of completion and incompletion in a single stroke, standing in Čakovec as a meditation on the perfection of the imperfect.

works.title: Love, Spice of Life
works.description: Love rendered in steel—permanent yet tender. A public sculpture in Koprivnica that serves as a gathering point, anchoring the community in a shared symbol of connection.

works.title: Book of Knowledge
works.description: Preserved not in pages but in forged metal. A sculpture at the Croatian State Archives that stands as a monument to the act of remembering—heavy, enduring, and open.

works.title: Sword of King Tomislav
works.description: The blade that unified a people. A public monument in Lovinac honoring the first King, blending authority with the raw permanence of the land.

works.title: Plasma Torch Hand
works.description: The hand emerges from what is taken away. 2mm CorTen steel marked by the searing passage of the plasma torch. A paradox of creation through destruction—neither invented nor made, but revealed.

works.title: Drawing with Plasma Torch
works.description: Plasma hand-cutting on raw metal sheets, enhanced with LED light installations. Wall metal art where industry and humanity collide — the torch reveals what the metal conceals.

works.title: The Cretan Bull
works.description: Symbol of the fertilizing power of the spirit. The bull represents the ability to contain the realizing power of the luminous mind without artifice.

works.title: The Stymphalian Birds
works.description: Extracting the root of duality. The birds represent the swarm of sensory thoughts; the sculpture captures the moment of their dismissal, freeing the mind from the noise of the vital nature.

works.title: The Stables (Augeas)
works.description: A great portal of rusted steel, half-sunken in the earth. Neither monument nor tomb, but a threshold where myth and relic intertwine—a reminder that no labor ever fully disappears.

works.title: Gardens of the Hesperides
works.description: Golden apples symbolizing Knowledge. To possess them is to access Truth. The sculpture invites the viewer into the garden of the mind, where limits constantly recede.

works.title: The Apples of the Hesperides
works.description: A sculptural interpretation of the ancient legend. Hercules' labor becomes a metaphor for the inner journey—the pursuit of wisdom and the golden fruits of self-discovery.

works.title: Atlas
works.description: The force of pushing. A hand gripping a pillar, exerting upward force against tremendous pressure. It symbolizes the continuous effort required to uphold the ideals of civilization.

works.title: Prometheus
works.description: The force of pulling. Bound by a chain, the hand struggles for liberation. A symbol of rebellion and the pursuit of knowledge against the constraints of authority.
